wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Arthur Alec Goschen  (6 January 1880 – 28 June 1975) was a British Army officer who served as an Area Commander during the Second World War.

response: The Goschen baronetcy, of Durrington House in the Parish of Sheering and County of Essex, was created in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom in the 1927 Birthday Honours on 27 June 1927 for the businessman Sir Harry Goschen, for public services. He was the son of Henry Goschen, younger brother of George Goschen, 1st Viscount Goschen, and elder brother of the first Baronet of the 1916 creation (see above). The title became extinct on his death in 1945. Major-General Arthur Goschen was a younger brother of Sir Harry.

In 1914, he married Eleanor Kathleen Goschen, the sister of Arthur Goschen.England and Wales Civil Registration Marriage Index, Jan 1914, Kensington 1a 1701881 England Census, Class: RG11; Piece: 807; Folio: 11; Page: 14; GSU roll: 1341190

His younger brother was Major General Arthur Goschen. Harry was educated at Eton College from 1879 to 1884. In 1886, he was gazetted as a lieutenant in the 24th Middlesex Volunteer Rifles, the London Regiment.
